newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - May 23. [CORRECTED 17:20 GMT]
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to watch - May 23. [CORRECTED 17:20 GMT]

text.p: -- Apple Computer Inc will set up a separate company to develop and sell its Newton hand-held computer and related products. The new company will be owned by Apple and Newton employees, Apple said.

-- Negotiators in tobacco talks are making progress on several key regulatory and legal issues, the New York Times reported. The newspaper, quoting sources close to the talks, said one issue involves a substantial penalty cigarette makers would pay if smoking by young people is not reduced by 50 percent after seven years.

-- Proffitt's Inc reported first quarter earnings of $0.37 per share, up from $0.25 a year earlier. It said it was comfortable with estimates that 1997 revenues will be between $2.375 billion and $2.425 billion.

-- U S West Media (corrects name) is near a deal to sell its cable systems in Minneapolis-St. Paul, Minn., to closely held Charter Communications for about $600 million, the Wall Street Journal reported.
